name: C. Ehab and a Special Coloring Problem
statement:
You’re given an integer n. For every integer i from 2 to n, assign a
positive integer a_i such that the following conditions hold: For any
pair of integers (i,j), if i and j are coprime, a_i
neq a_j. The maximal value of all a_i should be minimized (that is, as
small as possible). A pair of integers is called coprime if their
greatest common divisor is 1.
